body:
I've heard many players talking about this. If it is true, why not advertise Avicus more? I'm not saying to go on servers and blurt the IP. I'm saying, why don't we get as many people as possible to make YouTube videos about it. The Avicus merchandise is definitely taking it to the next level. So, why don't we post some ideas here that could help the Avicus network grow?

-Sky
body_tagged:

I'm saying, why don't we get as many people as possible to make YouTube videos about it. The Avicus merchandise is definitely taking it to the next level. So, why don't we post some ideas here that could help the Avicus network grow?

replies.body:
I hear what you're saying Skygirl, but i can't argue with the mods: I've noticed a phenomenal deviation in the numbers..
About 2 months ago, we were topping 200 - 250 absolute tops, and now (as mentioned) we climbed to a peak of around 550 - 570 people :)
We're making a comeback in my opinion :)

replies.body:
Don't think it is, but there is a lot less mods attending reports, if you /report people, no staff comes. Check a staff member's profile, they're online. .-.

I understand that staff members also want to play, but still. If multiple people report someone, then attend it.

Yes, we can see who's in the match by using /list, it includes spectators and players, and staff still have a tag, so don't respond by "you don't know if a staff member is there or not".

Sorry to complain, just putting my two cents in.
replies.body_tagged:
Don't think it is, but there is a lot less mods attending reports, if you /report people, no staff comes. Check a staff member's profile, they're online. .-.

I understand that staff members also want to play, but still. If multiple people report someone, then attend it.

Yes, we can see who's in the match by using /list, it includes spectators and players, and staff still have a tag, so don't respond by "you don't know if a staff member is there or not".

Sorry to complain, just putting my two cents in.
